content: #19393 has been stale for a bit, but I don't see any controversy around the PR. Can someone take a quick look at it? Up and down games are good building blocks for the rest of named games in combinatorial game theory.
I'm a bit late to the party, but I do agree that games such as star, up, down, etc. should be in their own file. The PGame file is already very big.

Should there be a separate file for special game birthdays (moving Birthday.lean to Basic.lean and a dedicated Special.lean) or should special games combine both? There's more special games / game modifiers (i.e tiny and miny) I would like to add, so I think the former world be better.
If you're importing Birthday, you're also importing ordinal arithmetic, and even natural operations. I think also importing special games is the least of your worries.
Refactoring all special games (including star) would conflict with PR #7162, so I'll wait until we resolve that one first.
No problem! I don't think this is high priority
